programmes.show_name: In Their Own Words: Gruff Rhys
programmes.show_description: From the archives, a selection of Gruff Rhys interviews with 6 Music through the years. The Super Furries frontman chats to Stuart Maconie in 2011, plus a 2018 Marc Riley session.
Gruff Rhys of Super Furry Animals pulls together a playlist of his favourite tracks ahead of the 6Music Festival, with some Japanese prog, Turkish pop and the odd birdcall.
Gruff Rhys, who performed at the 6 Music Festival in Cardiff, selects highlights from previous festivals, including Gwenno in Bristol in 2016 and the Fall in Tyneside in 2015.
Gruff Rhys, who performs at this year's 6 Music Festival in Cardiff, selects highlights from previous festivals, including Cate Le Bon and Grandaddy, recorded in Glasgow in 2017.
Gruff Rhys, who performs at this year's 6 Music Festival in Cardiff, selects highlights from previous festivals, including Sudan Archives, Imarhan, Julia Holter and Primal Scream.
The biggest tunes to start the day, plus there's your chance to vote on a 'Lost Love'.
Wonderful music to start your day, including the Cloudbusting mix to banish the grey skies.
Lauren gives you the finest blend of fantastic music for your Tuesday morning.
Legendary guitarist Zakk Wylde joins Craig to chat about the new Black Label Society album 'Engines Of Demolition'.
Songwriting expert Anjali Perin joins Huw to discuss how the artists from this year's 6 Music Festival line-up approach writing music.
London trio Hot Face are live in session from Salford, following the release of their debut album Automated Response.
Marc Riley and Gideon Coe welcome Bill Callahan, he of Smog fame, deep joy.
2/4. 6 Music Festival 2026 headliners The Horrors share records which have shaped their career.
Nathan Shepherd selects his fave grunge hits by Nirvana, L7, Dinosaur Jr and loads more.
Mark Lamarr with a series chronicling the history and development of reggae music.
Mark Lamarr with a series chronicling the history of reggae music. Tonight's guest is Alton Ellis.
A rare BBC session by Them, live sets from Del Amitri and C. Duncan, and Winston Reedy in concert from 1985.
Want to hear the latest tracks 6 Music have added to their playlist? Then listen here!
Names in Songs returns, can you hear your name in a well-known song?
Photographer and filmmaker Aidan Zamiri discusses his directorial debut, The Moment, starring Charli xcx.
Lauren gets your Wednesday going with the most magnificent music.
Craig celebrates your midweek wins for Wednesday, I'm In Love, and we hear another of your left-field music suggestions as we turn Left At The Lights.
Alexis and Green join Huw to talk collaborating on Alexis' new album 'Paris In Spring'. We'll also get to know London art-rock outfit Modern Woman in this weeks 'Huw Are You'.
Deb chats to Shabaka Hutchings about the music that has influenced his career, ahead of the release of his album Of The Earth.
Marc Riley and Gideon Coe are joined by Stereolab for tonight's session - super excited!
3/4. 6 Music Festival 2026 headliners The Horrors celebrate women in post-punk.
